channel.title: Fatal Java Error
channel.description:
While attempting to run any source, I receive this error:
# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d847786, pid=5324, tid=2124 # # JRE version: 6.0_21-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x57786] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #
Now, I can sign on and walk around for a little bit, then it closes out and this appears. (It's happened with the Silab Client and Galkon's)
Anyone have any idea what is going on? Thanks. (I'm also running on Windows 7, 64-bit)

Pretty sure im going to show up at your house and stare at you while you sleep

item.title: Fatal Java Error
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Ok i heard alot of people try to run 317 Client’s on a windows 7 computer and when they walk around it crash’s this should help alot it works 100% for me

  1. Ok First you need to download this - http://uppit.com/v/REKLK274

2.Open that up and click Windows 7 Coverter

3.Then You will see a line that says ( Batch File: ) Click the ( … ) on that line then a brows will pop up and go to your client folder and click your .bat that you use to run your client.

4.Then push compile.

5.Now your done! go back to your client folder and if you have a windows 7 computer you can play 317’s now and it wont crash the client.
credits to locksmin
dont use the run.bat one anymore, use the one that says application

Read full topic

item.title: Fatal Java Error

item.description:
@Warsham wrote:

While attempting to run any source, I receive this error:

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d847786, pid=5324, tid=2124

JRE version: 6.0_21-b07

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b17 mixed mode windows-amd64 )

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x57786]

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

Now, I can sign on and walk around for a little bit, then it closes out and this appears.
(It’s happened with the Silab Client and Galkon’s)

Anyone have any idea what is going on? Thanks.
(I’m also running on Windows 7, 64-bit)
